meanings.definition: A person who reproves or criticizes.
meanings.sent1: The reprovers at the meeting pointed out the mistakes made by the team.
meanings.sent2: She always listens to the reprovers in her life to improve herself.
meanings.sent3: The reprovers in the movie were portrayed as wise mentors guiding the main character.
meanings.sent4: Her conscience acted as a constant reprover, reminding her of her values.
meanings.sent5: The reprovers in the story wore glasses and carried red pens, ready to correct any errors.

meanings.sent1: He reprovers his friend gently when he sees him making a mistake.
meanings.sent2: She reprovers her students to help them learn from their errors.
meanings.sent3: The cat reprovers the dog for knocking over the vase with a disapproving meow.
meanings.sent4: The wind reprovers the leaves, whispering criticisms as it rustles through the trees.
meanings.sent5: His words reprovers like a sharp knife, cutting through the excuses and revealing the truth.
